trans-unit.source: The .NET Framework creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerProtocol"></xref> class to process XML Web service requests.

You can override the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerProtocol.RouteRequest%2A> method to process XML Web service requests that are not explicitly declared and handled by users through a method in their XML Web service marked with `WebMethodAttribute`.
Returns an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlTextReader"></xref> initialized with the specified <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage"></xref> and buffer size.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage"></xref> with which to initialize the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlTextReader"></xref>.
The buffer size with which to initialize the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlTextReader"></xref>.
A initialized with the specified by message and the buffer size specified by bufferSize.
Returns an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlTextWriter"></xref> initialized with the specified <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage"></xref> and buffer size.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage"></xref> with which to initialize the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlTextWriter"></xref>.
The buffer size with which to initialize the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlTextWriter"></xref>.
A initialized with the specified by message and the buffer size specified by bufferSize.
Applies the specified priority and group attributes to the SOAP extensions contained in the specified array of type <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension"></xref>.
A that specifies the priority and group attributes to be applied to the SOAP extensions contained in extensions.
An array of type to which to apply the priority and group attributes specified by group.
An array of type with the priority and group attributes specified by group applied.
Returns the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMethod"></xref> to which the specified <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage"></xref> should be routed.

You can override the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerProtocol.RouteRequest%2A> method to process XML Web service requests that are not explicitly declared and handled by users through a method in their XML Web service marked with `WebMethodAttribute`.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage"></xref> sent to the XML Web service.
The to which the specified by message should be routed.
